metadata.title: CVE-2020-14304 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description: A memory disclosure flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ethernet drivers,in the way it read data from the EEPROM of the device. This flaw allows alocal user to read uninitialized values from the kernel memory. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2020-10-26').
linux-aws package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oracle package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in noble is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
